title: AI-Powered Meeting Summarization & Action Items
description: Transform meeting recordings and notes into actionable summaries with clear next steps

steps.title: Initial Meeting Analysis and Context Setting
steps.description: Analyze the raw meeting content and establish context for comprehensive summarization
steps.toolReason: Superior at complex analysis and pattern recognition across long documents. Essential for extracting meaningful insights from unstructured meeting data.
steps.prompt:
You are an experienced executive assistant with expertise in meeting management and organizational efficiency. Take time to think step by step through this meeting content.

<instructions>
Analyze this meeting content and extract:
1. Meeting purpose and objectives
2. Key participants and their roles
3. Main discussion topics
4. Decisions made
5. Action items with clear ownership
6. Follow-up meetings or deadlines

Think step by step through the content. If any information is unclear or missing, note specific clarifying questions that should be asked.
</instructions>

<meeting_content>
[Paste meeting transcript, recording, or notes here]
</meeting_content>

<context>
Meeting type: [team standup/project review/strategic planning/etc.]
Team/Department: [specify]
Date: [meeting date]
</context>

Structure your analysis using these XML tags:
<thinking>
[Your step-by-step analysis process]
</thinking>

<summary>
[Concise meeting summary]
</summary>

<action_items>
[Clear, actionable items with owners and deadlines]
</action_items>

<clarifying_questions>
[Any questions needed for complete understanding]
</clarifying_questions>
tips: Provide the full meeting context - type, participants, and objectives
If the AI seems confused, clarify the meeting format or provide more context
Use specific participant names when available for better action item assignment
Ask follow-up questions if action items lack clear ownership or deadlines

steps.title: Action Item Prioritization and Distribution
steps.description: Transform extracted action items into a prioritized, distributable format
steps.toolReason: Excellent at formatting and structuring information for different audiences and communication styles
steps.prompt:
You are a project manager with extensive experience in task management and team coordination. Think through this step by step to create the most effective action plan.

<instructions>
Take the action items from the meeting summary and:
1. Prioritize by urgency and importance (High/Medium/Low)
2. Add realistic time estimates for each task
3. Identify any dependencies between tasks
4. Create individualized task lists for each team member
5. Suggest follow-up check-in points

If you notice missing information (unclear deadlines, vague tasks, missing owners), ask specific clarifying questions.
</instructions>

<action_items>
[Paste the action items from previous step]
</action_items>

<team_context>
Team size: [number]
Project timeline: [timeline]
Upcoming deadlines: [any relevant deadlines]
</team_context>

Format your response as:
<prioritized_tasks>
[Tasks organized by priority with clear details]
</prioritized_tasks>

<individual_assignments>
[Personalized task lists for each team member]
</individual_assignments>

<follow_up_plan>
[Recommended check-in schedule and methods]
</follow_up_plan>

<dependencies>
[Task dependencies and potential blockers]
</dependencies>
tips: Be specific about deadlines - use actual dates, not relative terms
Break down large tasks into smaller, manageable sub-tasks
Consider team members' current workload when estimating capacity
Set up automated reminders for critical deadlines
